$550 Billion Infrastructure Deal + $3.5 Trillion Reconciliation Package.

We have a rare chance to show the American public that our government can have a positive, tangible impact in peoples’ lives.

We must pass both bills.

name: Rep. Ro Khanna
tweet_text:
A wealth tax on the ultra-rich is not vindictive, it’s about:

1. Asking everyone to do their part
2. Generating $ for investments in our future to benefit us all
3. Curbing the extreme inequality in our county that undermines our democracy

That’s how we build a better America.

name: Rep. Ro Khanna
tweet_text: There is still time to limit warming to 1.5°C. The U.S. and the rest of the world must cut emissions in half over the next ten years and achieve net-zero emissions by 2050. We must pass an infrastructure bill to invest in and create a clean economy with sustainable jobs.

name: Rep. Ro Khanna
tweet_text: The political influence, dark money, and disinformation of the fossil fuel industry have held back a rapid and innovative shift to clean energy. We are now paying, with our lives and our health, for those decades of delay.

name: Rep. Ro Khanna
tweet_text: The UN Sec. General today called to end fossil fuel subsidies and shift to investments in renewable energy. I'm pushing to include the End Polluter Welfare Act, which eliminates fossil fuel subsidies, in the infrastructure package.

name: Rep. Ro Khanna
tweet_text: But it is not too late to prevent the worst impacts. Every bit of warming means more intense heat, more storms, and more flooding. For example, the report estimates extreme rain will intensify by 7% for each 1°C warming.

name: Rep. Ro Khanna
tweet_text: Even if we stopped all CO2 emissions today, sea level rise would continue for centuries, reshaping our coastlines and inundating cities and island nations.

name: Rep. Ro Khanna
tweet_text: Burning fossil fuels led to more widespread and severe wildfires, tropical storms, droughts, and coastal flooding. Heatwaves have approximately doubled in frequency since the 1980s.

name: Rep. Ro Khanna
tweet_text: Humans have caused almost all of the current warming, about 1.07°C out of 1.09°C. Since the last IPCC Assessment Report, scientific evidence of the link between global warming and current extreme weather events has grown.

name: Rep. Ro Khanna
tweet_text: This report is the clearest description of how dire the climate emergency has become, and the clearest call to action we’ve ever received on the greatest existential crisis of our time. We’ve already warmed about 1.09°C globally since the pre-industrial average during 1850-1900.

name: Rep. Ro Khanna
tweet_text:
The UN’s climate change report confirms we've already warmed the globe and must act immediately to prevent it from worsening. Global warming is causing heat waves, stronger storms, flooding, and droughts.  
 
The stakes are clear for the infrastructure bill. No climate no deal.

name: Rep. Ro Khanna
tweet_text:
In sum:

❌ FBI & DOJ officials can’t identify & locate sex trafficking victims & perpetrators as well.  

❌ Sex workers are more unsafe.

❌ Is anyone actually safer because of FOSTA-SESTA? No.

✅ Is it time to repeal this law? Yes. 8/8

name: Rep. Ro Khanna
tweet_text:
Issue #3: The financial aspect is harder to track.

Following laundered 💵 through shell companies based in corporate secrecy jurisdictions is significantly more difficult than following laundered money through U.S.-based financial institutions that are subject to U.S. laws. 7/

name: Rep. Ro Khanna
tweet_text:
Issue #2: It’s become *harder* to find evidence of sex trafficking.

The commercial market has moved overseas & investigators are less familiar with new platforms - many of which refuse to voluntarily respond to legal inquiries. Mutual assistance can take months, if not years. 6/

name: Rep. Ro Khanna
tweet_text:
Issue #1: Criminal restitution has not been sought even once under FOSTA-SESTA.

It's easier for prosecutors to use racketeering & money laundering charges to prosecute sex trafficking. For a law passed specifically to help prosecutors, FOSTA-SESTA has gotten very little use. 5/

name: Rep. Ro Khanna
tweet_text: After FOSTA-SESTA was enacted, these sites (and the tools that came with them) shuttered overnight. The law was meant to make it easier to prosecute sex trafficking. But according to the government's own study, it’s only made things worse for sex workers. 4/

name: Rep. Ro Khanna
tweet_text: Before FOSTA-SESTA, many sex workers used online platforms to screen clients. Negotiations could happen virtually, instead of on the street. Some sites even provided vetting tools, like blacklists of dangerous clients. All of this meant that working online was safer. 3/

name: Rep. Ro Khanna
tweet_text: In 2018, against the advice of multiple sex worker coalitions & many advocates, Congress passed FOSTA-SESTA. The bill made websites legally liable for content that helps "facilitate prostitution." But there was no distinction made for consensual sex work. 2/

name: Rep. Ro Khanna
tweet_text:
In June, the GAO released a report on sex trafficking. The findings were as we expected: there's no evidence that FOSTA/SESTA has made it easier to find & prosecute incidents of sex trafficking. If anything, it's made it  impossible.

Let's rewind ⬇️ 1/
https://t.co/TPzJAqf6hm
